text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Cyprus newspapers on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The rates of development and inflation are satisfactory. Expenses on travel and overtime will not increase, Finance Minister Christodoulos Christodoulou says.
- Water dams almost eampty. The public needs to become conscious of the problem and save water, head of water department Lakis Christodoulou says.
- United Nations dismisses speculation that Turkish ship was laying mines or other barriers in the Kappari area of Paralimni on Wednesday.
- Permits have been granted for building new hotels within the boundaries of the proposed Akamas national park.
- Seven building contractors compete for the construction of the new hospital in Nicosia.
- President Glafcos Clerides said nothing during council of ministers meeting yesterday about a cabinet reshuffle.
